ai-patthana18.4:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma, third in the place he had allowed to,
ai-patthana18.4:1.1_0: Not for the sake of fewness of wishes, not for the sake of a teaching, nor for the support of the teaching,
ai-patthana18.4:1.1_1: It is not the condition for the root, not for the sake of the teaching, nor by the object of the Dhamma,
ai-patthana18.4:1.1_2: It is not due to the root of the teaching, or to the root of the tree, or to condition.
ai-patthana18.4:1.1_3: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana18.4:2.1_0: (They are) three supports that are to say: of each one without intention,
ai-patthana18.4:3.1_0: Not for the sake of its cause, not for the sake of the teaching, nor for the sake of the teaching, nor for the support of the teaching.
ai-patthana18.4:3.1_1: Not for the sake of its cause, not for the sake of the Dhamma, nor for the support of the Dhamma, and for the support of the Dhamma.
ai-patthana18.4:3.1_2: Not for the sake of another, or for the sake of the sake of the Teaching, nor for the sake of all its support, nor for the sake of this Dhamma, nor for the sake of investigating, and for the sake of (of the teaching).
ai-patthana18.4:3.1_3: The three (goods) have been planted in brief, and the three watches of the night, when there was none, it was although non-disappearance at all.
ai-patthana18.4:4.1_0: for the sake of not giving up a cause, for the sake of the teaching, not for the sake of this is the reason.
ai-patthana18.4:4.1_1: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana18.4:4.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.4:5.1_0: You don’t give rise to repulsion for the sake of repulsion. You don’t give rise to a cause or condition for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana18.4:6.1_0: it doesn’t give rise to repulsion without cause or reason.
ai-patthana18.4:6.1_1: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana18.4:6.1_2: one person is building up one another while mutually saying:
ai-patthana18.4:6.1_3: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.4:7.1_0: for he doesn’t give rise to the cause or reason for form.
ai-patthana18.4:7.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.4:8.1_0: for the sake of another, or for the sake of the teaching, there is no cause or condition for the sake of reason.
ai-patthana18.4:8.1_1: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana18.4:8.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.4:9.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.4:10.1_0: for the sake of inspection, not for the sake of worldly conditions.
ai-patthana18.4:10.1_1: or cause he doesn’t give rise to the supermundane conditions for the sake of the world.
ai-patthana18.4:10.1_2: Because it’s not possible to give a teaching or training because of that.
ai-patthana18.4:10.1_3: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana18.4:10.1_4: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.4:11.1_0: Perceiving only for the sake of another, not for the sake of function, there is no reason for the sake of which there arises.
ai-patthana18.4:12.1_0: Because it’s not easy for someone who understands the teaching, nor for someone whose teaching is independent.
